critique: This chest CT scan shows bilateral small pleural effusions (Option D), indicated by smooth opacifications within the pleural space (white arrows). The effusions appear to be layering in the most dependent spaces in this supine patient. In contrast, chest images in mesothelioma commonly show a unilateral pleural abnormality with a large, unilateral pleural effusion.
educational_objective: Recognize pleural effusions on a chest CT scan.
question_stem: Which of the following abnormalities is present?
question_text: A 68-year-old woman with dyspnea is evaluated with chest CT.
